title: 'The Wizard of the Kremlin': Inside the turbulent Latvian shoot of Assayas' film
subhead: Olivier Assayas's film, adapted from Giuliano da Empoli's eponymous book, will be released in France on Wednesday. In Latvia, the country chosen for the shoot, the costly project encountered unexpected financial obstacles and faced criticism over what was seen as an overly positive portrayal of Russian figures.

title: In Minneapolis, Trump tries to put out the fire started by his administration
Former French senator on trial over alleged drugging of female colleague: 'There are things I could tell you, man to man'
Gregory Bovino, the face of the militarized fight against immigration, ousted from Minneapolis
subhead: The commander-at-large of the US Border Patrol, known for its aggressive and illegal tactics, came under criticism after his agents killed nurse Alex Pretti in Minneapolis during a protest.

title: India and EU conclude free trade agreement that reduces tariffs in many sectors
subhead: The agreement, struck after two decades of talks, aims to cut tariffs on nearly all European exports and create a market of roughly two billion people.

title: Social pressure, puberty and sexism push teenage girls out of sports, study finds
subhead: A survey by French health insurance provider MGEN reveals that nearly half of young girls reported giving up sports, despite genuine interest, due to social constraints, gender stereotypes or changes in their bodies.

title: Czech billionaire Kretinsky's takeover of Fnac Darty aims to block Chinese giant JD.com's influence
subhead: Daniel Kretinsky launched a takeover bid for Fnac Darty, where he was already the largest shareholder. If successful, he could prevent the e-commerce giant JD.com from gaining an indirect stake in the retailer. The French government is closely monitoring the deal.

subhead: The 37-year-old nurse was killed Saturday after federal immigration agents fired at least 10 shots.

title: Valeria Bruni Tedeschi: 'With the rise of the far right, artists feel crushed'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the actress, who plays the legendary Italian stage performer Eleonora Duse in Pietro Marcello's latest film, discusses the difficult situation facing film d'auteur in Italy.

title: Gabriel Attal pushes ahead with presidential bid, despite doubts within party
subhead: Criticized internally for his political positioning and strategy, the former French prime minister rejects comparisons with his longtime mentor, Emmanuel Macron.
